symptoms.name: Eschar
symptoms.pattern: Develops ~1 week post-bite, starts as raised spot, develops blister, then dries to brown/black crust

symptoms.name: Rash
symptoms.pattern: Vesicular, starts 1-10 days post-bite, resolves in 2-3 weeks, not on palms/soles

vital_signs.heart_rate: Elevated (105 bpm reported in one case)

physical_findings: Mild crackles at lung base (reported in one case)

lab_values.leukocytes: Elevated (16.7 × 10^9 cells/L reported in one case)
lab_values.hemoglobin: Decreased (100 g/L reported in one case)
lab_values.creatinine: Elevated (191 µmol/L reported in one case)
lab_values.C-reactive protein: Elevated (342 mg/L reported in one case)
lab_values.AST: Slightly elevated (71 U/L reported in one case)
lab_values.ALT: Slightly elevated (64 U/L reported in one case)
lab_values.albumin: Slightly decreased (28 g/L reported in one case)

risk_factors: Exposure to house mice and their mites (Liponyssoides sanguineus)
Living in urban environments with rodent infestations
Exposure to bats and mice (reported in one case)

CT scan (abdomen and pelvis): Marked inflammatory change in right retroperitoneal fascial planes
Small amount of fluid in perirectal space
Small pericardial and left pleural effusions

supportive: Elevated SFGR titers in convalescent serum
Positive R. akari species-specific serology (significant increase in IgG titers)
